main event: A red object 3 times the brightness of Jupiter was observed changing to orange while maneuvering in the sky over Harrow-Weald.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for approximately 30-60 seconds., The object was first observed at 45 degrees elevation and moved to 30 degrees elevation., The object changed direction with sharp and angular turns., The object emitted no sound and had no discernible features besides its shape and size., The conditions at the time were ideal for observation, allowing clear visibility of the object.
sighted object: one red object changing to orange
witness description: Civilians, including a 25-year-old woman and a military sergeant.
